Ngaku Pegawai Kemenko Polhukam dan Bisa Urus Umrah, Irwan Ditangkap Polisi
03 Nov 2019, 21:41 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - Polisi menangkap Irwan alias Iwan bin Momer (56) karena menipu korban hingga mengalami kerugian belasan juta rupiah. Modus Irwan adalah meyakinkan korban dengan mengaku sebagai pegawai Kemenko Polhukam dan bisa memberangkatkan umrah.
"Tersangka sering mendatangi perkantoran-perkantoran dan mencari calon korban dengan menawarkan berbagai jenis jasa, salah satunya menawarkan jasa pengurusan perjalanan ibadah umrah," kata Direktur Kriminal Umum Polda Metro Jaya Kombes Suyudi Ario Seto dalam keterangannya kepada wartawan, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Suyudi mengatakan kasus penipuan itu terjadi pada 13 Juni 2019. Tersangka saat itu menjumpai korbannya yang ingin memberangkatkan umrah orang tuanya. Tersangka meyakinkan korban dengan berpakaian seperti pegawai Kemenko Polhukam.
"Untuk meyakinkan korban, tersangka menggunakan seragam Kementerian Polhukam dan dilengkapi ID Card," jelas Suyudi.
Singkat cerita, ketika korban sudah percaya dengan tersangka, tersangka meminta sejumlah uang dengan alasan mengurus umrah. Setelah tersangka mendapatkan uang dari korban, tersangka menghilang dan korban sudah tidak bisa menghubungi tersangka.
"Korban melakukan transfer ke rekening milik tersangka sejumlah Rp 15 juta. Setelah melakukan transfer dana itu korban tidak bisa menghubungi tersangka dan korban sadar bahwa telah ditipu," kata Suyudi.
Korban langsung membuat laporan ke Polda Metro Jaya. Menindaklanjuti kasus itu, tim Subdit Resmob Ditreskrimum Polda Metro Jaya kemudian mengamankan tersangka Irwan di wilayah Cipinang, Jakarta Timur pada 29 Oktober 2019.
"Atas perbuatannya, tersangka dikenakan Pasal tindak pidana penipuan dan atau penggelapan sebagaimana dimaksud dalam Pasal 378 KUHP dan atau 372 KUHP," pungkas Suyudi.

Claiming that the Coordinating Minister for Political, Legal and Security Affairs Can Take Care of Umrah, Irwan Arrested by Police
03 Nov 2019, 21:41 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - Police arrested Irwan alias Iwan bin Momer (56) for cheating the victim to a loss of tens of millions of rupiah. Irwan's mode is to convince the victim by claiming to be an employee of the Coordinating Ministry for Politics and Security and can dispatch the Umrah.
"Suspects often come to offices and look for potential victims by offering various types of services, one of which offers services for organizing Umrah pilgrimage," said Director of the Criminal General of the Jakarta Metropolitan Police Senior Commissioner Suyudi Ario Seto in his statement to reporters on Sunday (3/11/2019 ).
Suyudi said that the fraud case occurred on June 13, 2019. The suspect at that time met his victim who wanted to dispatch his parents' Umrah. The suspect convinced the victim by dressing up as an employee at the Coordinating Ministry for Politics and Security.
"To convince the victim, the suspect used the uniform of the Ministry of Law and Security and was equipped with an ID Card," Suyudi explained.
Long story short, when the victim already believes in the suspect, the suspect asks for some money on the grounds of taking care of the Umrah. After the suspect gets the money from the victim, the suspect disappears and the victim is unable to contact the suspect.
"The victim made a transfer to the suspect's account of Rp. 15 million. After transferring the funds the victim could not contact the suspect and the victim was aware that he had been cheated," Suyudi said.
The victim immediately made a report to the Jakarta Police. Following up on the case, the Resmob Sub Directorate of the Directorate of Criminal Investigation and the Jakarta Police then secured the suspect Irwan in the Cipinang area, East Jakarta on October 29, 2019.
"For their actions, the suspect is subject to Article fraud and / or embezzlement as referred to in Article 378 of the Criminal Code and or 372 of the Criminal Code," concluded Suyudi.
